commit_message:
Fix UC pre-flight for the missing templates dir

Complements https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582529/.

For some cases, like mixed UC/OC deployments or
upgrades, the missing templates directory may be
passed in, so it will be populated later from the
default t-h-t RPM dir.  Run t-h-t validation
against that default t-h-t path then.  That is RPM
directory and it is ensured via the package
dependencies.

Related-bug: #1781600
Partial-bug: #1781227

Change-Id: I3615d9be8c706560661e3c266a24dbe6e14987f7
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/16/582916/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # For some cases, the missing tht_path directory will be # populated later. Do validation against the default t-h-t path then. # That is RPM directory and it is ensured via the package dependencies. if not os.path.exists(tht_path): tht_path = constants.TRIPLEO_HEAT_TEMPLATES

commit_message:
Follow the new PTI for document build

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

For more details information, please refer to:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

In order to pass the requirements check, a new lower bound is set for the
'pyasn1' and 'requests' packages.

Change-Id: I7c1a9f6e2e4f74b90a12ccf277f829b67b7f332f

commit_message:
Use tests repo for common role test requirements

Using tox for requirements management requires in-repo
requirements files for all our repositories. Rather than
do that, we make use of the tests repo to capture our
common requirements and use this to install them.

This reduces our review requirement rate and simplifies
maintenance for us for the tox config. It also makes it
usable with 'Depends-On', which is marvellous!

The tox requirements definitions for docs/releasenotes
builds are left in-place as those are standard entries
across the community. If that changes at some point, we
can re-assess those entries too.

Some old test cruft is also removed.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/579208
Change-Id: Iee798c2660f69afe7c40cd3d2e9b801434944eff

commit_message:
Fix populate templates dir for mixed UC/OC cases

If source templates dir does not exist, create it and populate from
the t-h-t system directory (installed from RPM).

Then retain the undercloud and overcloud --templates directories
separated to prevent versions collisions.

This may be the case for mixed UC/OC deployments or upgrades, which
require different versions of t-h-t either initially, or the versions
may diverge in the process of serial UC then OC update/upgrade.

Change-Id: I4cdc54662f6ec18d605c00a2c588c5bb1a56d14e
Partial-Bug: #1781577
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Enable externalIPs for DevStack's OpenShift

To prevent errors like:

  Failed to persist updated LoadBalancerStatus to service
  'default/kuryr-service-52130480': Service "kuryr-service-52130480" is
  invalid: spec.externalIPs: Forbidden: externalIPs have been disabled

in openshfit-master logs, this commit enables externalIPs.

Change-Id: I2b353c39091d11f4c19366e18d05d4b76c77581c
Closes-Bug: 1779894

commit_message:
Change pylint requirement

pylint 2.0.0 and newer releases do not support Python 2, which breaks
Python 2 tests. This patch changes the requirement for pylint to use
version 1.9.1. The requirement is moved out of test-requirements.txt,
since pylint is not tracked in global requirements.

Change-Id: I2464ff2fc56b7fe7a92c40ec1555880f4e220479

commit_message:
Pull in ldap dependencies via ldappool

For the transition from pyldap to python-ldap, we can use ldappool
to pull in the correct variant of ldap for us. so we don't need
to depend on pyldap nor python-ldap.

Change-Id: I672b0bf3f4fa64e0fad3edfd902756e0f4a75342

commit_message:
use retry_db_errors from neutron-lib

The externally consumed APIs from neutron.db.api were rehomed into
neutron-lib with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557040/

This patch consumes the retry_db_errors function from lib by:
- Removing retry_db_errors from neutron.db.api
- Updating the imports for retry_db_errors to use it from lib
- Using the DB API retry fixture from lib in the UTs where applicable
- Removing the UTs for neutron.db.api as they are now covered in lib

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: I1feb842d3e0e92c945efb01ece29856335a398fe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/16/570016/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: f_with_retry = api.retry_db_errors(f)
deleted_lines: from oslo_db import api as oslo_db_api_retry_db_errors = oslo_db_api.wrap_db_retry( max_retries=MAX_RETRIES, retry_interval=0.1, inc_retry_interval=True, exception_checker=is_retriable ) def retry_db_errors(f): """Nesting-safe retry decorator with auto-arg-copy and logging. Retry decorator for all functions which do not accept a context as an argument. If the function accepts a context, use 'retry_if_session_inactive' below. If retriable errors are retried and exceed the count, they will be tagged with a flag so is_retriable will no longer recognize them as retriable. This prevents multiple applications of this decorator (and/or the one below) from retrying the same exception. """ @_tag_retriables_as_unretriable @_retry_db_errors @six.wraps(f) def wrapped(*args, **kwargs): try: # copy mutable args and kwargs to make retries safe. this doesn't # prevent mutations of complex objects like the context or 'self' dup_args = [_copy_if_lds(a) for a in args] dup_kwargs = {k: _copy_if_lds(v) for k, v in kwargs.items()} return f(*dup_args, **dup_kwargs) except Exception as e: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): if is_retriable(e): LOG.debug("Retry wrapper got retriable exception: %s", e) return wrapped f_with_retry = retry_db_errors(f)

commit_message:
doc: Fix arg specs and object types in docs

The usage doc stated that plug and unplug accept a single argument of
type `os_vif.objects.VIF`, which isn't a thing, and then went on to give
an example showing that they take two.  The usage doc and the plug and
unplug docstrings also listed various objects at the wrong paths (e.g.
the `instance_info` param being of type `os_vif.objects.InstanceInfo`,
which also isn't a thing).

Fixed up the usage doc to list both arguments and correct the references
in the sample code; and fixed the plug/unplug docstrings
to list the proper paths to classes: os_vif.objects.vif.VIFBase and
os_vif.objects.instance_info.InstanceInfo.

Made everything in `single backticks` into a proper rst ``literal``.

Change-Id: I400838bbe9663917fe2c64f52975b77a370405b4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-vif refs/changes/51/575151/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: functions: `os_vif.plug()` and `os_vif.unplug()`. Both methods accept an argument of type `os_vif.objects.VIF` and an argument of type `os_vif.objects.InstanceInfo`:
deleted_lines: functions: `os_vif.plug()` and `os_vif.unplug()`. Both methods accept a single argument of type `os_vif.objects.VIF`:

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because of that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I38db902c553d25f528b3ba9a80e185705f327b24
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin refs/changes/88/579788/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3

commit_message:
Adjust filters on listing availability zones

In before, filtering of AZs is using the filter implementation of
agents. To filter the AZs, users need to find the AZ fields to filter,
locate their corresponding fields in agent, and compile the filters
based on the mapping between AZ and agent. This is undesirable.

This patch improve the filtering of AZ by converting the AZ filters
to agent filters. The supporting AZ filters are:
* name: the name of the availability zone
* state: the value is either 'available' or 'unavailable'
* resource: the value is either 'network' or 'router'

NOTE: For backward-compatibility, the old filters still works but
its usage is discourage.

APIImpact: Add filters to specify attributes of availability zones

Needed-By: Icbf427f20ca912a40d68e8042abeeabffeb3005f
Change-Id: Id882f949cc73a34290c311f3ce3d69d1b809c29f

added_lines: import sixRESOURCE_AGENT_TYPE_MAP = { 'network': constants.AGENT_TYPE_DHCP, 'router': constants.AGENT_TYPE_L3, } STATE_ADMIN_STATE_UP_MAP = { 'available': True, 'unavailable': False, } AZ_ATTRIBUTE_MAP = { 'name': { 'agent_key': 'availability_zone', 'convert_to': lambda x: x, }, 'resource': { 'agent_key': 'agent_type', 'convert_to': lambda x: RESOURCE_AGENT_TYPE_MAP.get(x, x), }, 'state': { 'agent_key': 'admin_state_up', 'convert_to': lambda x: STATE_ADMIN_STATE_UP_MAP.get(x, x), } } filters = self._adjust_az_filters(filters or {}) def _adjust_az_filters(self, filters): az_filters = {} # The intersect of sets gets us applicable filter keys (others ignored) common_keys = six.viewkeys(filters) & six.viewkeys(AZ_ATTRIBUTE_MAP) for key in common_keys: filter_vals = filters[key] if filter_vals: filter_key = AZ_ATTRIBUTE_MAP[key]['agent_key'] filter_vals = [AZ_ATTRIBUTE_MAP[key]['convert_to'](v) for v in filter_vals] az_filters[filter_key] = filter_vals return az_filters

subject: Fix get LoadBalancer IP implementation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-12 07:25:17.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr_tempest_plugin/tests/scenario/base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-tempest-plugin/commit/9a68b877040db4e651228dd38e921f72956d035e', 'message': "Fix get LoadBalancer IP implementation

For services of Type 'LoadBalancer'  Kuryr controller stores the
External IP at service.status.
In some cases, OpenShift may overwrite the service.status value.
This patch updates 'get_service_ip' to return the IP that was allocated by Kuryr controller.

Change-Id: Ia5f766ba938e2972c022fb1e7cbf3c0374a344f2
"}]
commit_message:
Fix get LoadBalancer IP implementation

For services of Type 'LoadBalancer'  Kuryr controller stores the
External IP at service.status.
In some cases, OpenShift may overwrite the service.status value.
This patch updates 'get_service_ip' to return the IP that was allocated by Kuryr controller.

Change-Id: Ia5f766ba938e2972c022fb1e7cbf3c0374a344f2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-tempest-plugin refs/changes/83/581983/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import jsonK8S_ANNOTATION_PREFIX = 'openstack.org/kuryr' K8S_ANNOTATION_LBAAS_STATE = K8S_ANNOTATION_PREFIX + '-lbaas-state' # NOTE(yboaron): In some cases, OpenShift may overwrite # LB's IP stored at service.status, we need to make sure that # this function will return the IP that was annotated by # Kuryr controller if service.status.load_balancer.ingress: endpoints = api.read_namespaced_endpoints( service_name, namespace) annotations = endpoints.metadata.annotations try: ann_dict = json.loads( annotations[K8S_ANNOTATION_LBAAS_STATE]) ann_lb_ip = ( ann_dict["versioned_object.data"] ["service_pub_ip_info"] ["versioned_object.data"] ["ip_addr"]) except KeyError: LOG.info("Waiting till LB's IP appears in annotation " "(ingress.ip=%s)" % service.status.load_balancer.ingress[0].ip) continue if ann_lb_ip != service.status.load_balancer.ingress[0].ip: LOG.warning('Annotated pub_ip(%s) != ingress.ip(%s).' % ann_lb_ip, service.status.load_balancer.ingress[0].ip) return ann_lb_ip cls.service_ip = cls.get_service_ip(service_name, spec_type=spec_type)

commit_message:
Switch to using stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is
maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.

Let's switch it then.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Idf2f91565f9205c745a7110be5bf81267bd3caf5
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

added_lines: NovaComputeDockerUpgradeWithNfs: default: false description: Whether to allow rolling upgrades from baremetal to docker when NFS is used for nova instances. As manual intervention is required this defaults to false. type: boolean - name: "Check if nova instances is NFS" command: cut -d ' ' -f2-3 /proc/mounts | grep '/var/lib/nova/instances nfs' ignore_errors: True register: nova_instances_is_nfs_result - name: Set fact nova_instances_is_nfs set_fact: nova_instances_is_nfs: "{{ nova_instances_is_nfs_result.rc == 0 }}" - name: Set fact to indicate NFS issues have been addressed set_fact: nova_allow_nfs_upgrade: {get_param: NovaComputeDockerUpgradeWithNfs} - name: "PreUpgrade step0,validation: Ensure nova instances is not NFS when upgrading from baremetal" fail: msg: "Upgrading from baremetal to containers with an NFS backend requires manual intervention" tags: validation when: - not nova_allow_nfs_upgrade|bool - nova_compute_enabled|bool - nova_instances_is_nfs|bool

commit_message:
Only run nova status-check once a compute host has registered

The placement service doesn't work correctly until a compute host
has registered and the cellv2_discover has run.

To make sure this happens, we perform the status check after the
cell_v2 discover on the same conductor node which performed it.

Change-Id: Ie6e2463549f71f845148cac7cf09db3d0feb59d2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova refs/changes/27/582627/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The nova-status upgrade check command is typically run after upgrading the # controller services to new code, but is also OK to run for a greenfield # install to verify everything is setup correctly. This must run after cell # mapping setup and online data migrations have run. # https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/cli/nova-status.html - name: Run nova-status upgrade check to validate a healthy configuration command: "{{ nova_bin }}/nova-status upgrade check" become: yes become_user: "{{ nova_system_user_name }}" register: nova_status_upgrade_check until: nova_status_upgrade_check is success retries: 3 delay: 15 # The nova-status upgrade check command has three standard return codes: # 0: all checks were successful # 1: warning: there might be some checks that require investigation, but # generally will not block an automated install/upgrade; digging into # warnings is useful for debugging post-install/upgrade issues # 2: at least one check failed and must stop the install/upgrade because # something was not setup properly failed_when: "nova_status_upgrade_check.rc not in [0, 1]" changed_when: false

commit_message:
Remove redundant apt cache update task

There's no reason for this task to be in its own file.
It's not used anywhere but this play. The task also is
not necessary, given that every role does its own updates
when it needs to and the test execution does a cache
update right at the start in order to install the dependent
packages.

All in all, this is a waste of time, so let's just purge it.

Change-Id: I9cc872189b87eb65c4ee7623d4141be41d207f7a

commit_message:
Add logic to create PReP partition for ppc64* arch

When booting a partition image localy, ppc64* expects an 8 MiB
partition, with the prep and boot flags set, containing the
bootloader [0]. This patch adds logic to ironic-lib to create
the parition with these flags when the node has a ppc64* arch.

[0] https://www.ibm.com/developerworks/community/wikis/home?lang=en#!/wiki/W51a7ffcf4dfd_4b40_9d82_446ebc23c550/page/PowerLinux%20Boot%20howto

Change-Id: I8f9748dd58146bfb2411c229b02969e0faf18222
Story: #1749057
Task: #22998

commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

Change-Id: I9ce106569ced891c551b36506d360e4b8718c7e3

commit_message:
Use local connection and become for nova_compute

The nova_compute group contains localhost, but due to
the name being different, it was missed in [1].

When targeting localhost with 'remote_user: root' and
using 'become: yes' we lose the environment variables
for the user running the playbook (eg: USER, HOME).

However, if we use 'connection: local' and 'become: yes'
together, it works properly. We apply this change to
ensure this play also has the correct access to change
things on the host.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/582359
Change-Id: Ia87e02c3b965be6f384d2f64911f0af2e4c2d598
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-tests refs/changes/57/582957/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Due to the need of loading kernel module, # we need to set become: true become: true

We should contact K8s API through the LB we're creating for that

commit_message:
Allow access to K8s API LB from the host

We should contact K8s API through the LB we're creating for that
purpose. Turns out that's impossible with LBaaS v2 and openvswitch
firewall driver.

This commit fixes that by adding required SGs to LB and kubelet port to
allow incoming traffic.

Closes-Bug 1781584

Change-Id: I7c7d6860471c1eb2804935d8dddfa771289abc49
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/17/582517/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "$KURYR_K8S_OCTAVIA_MEMBER_MODE" == "L3" ]] || \ [[ "$use_octavia" == "False" ]]; then

commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

With the dependent patches, the openstack_openrc role is now executed once
on the designated host, so it is no longer required as a meta-dependency for
the role.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/582359
Change-Id: Ic844753c3ece4383eefa490f00be0bff441c6a7e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_zaqar refs/changes/81/582381/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: # zaqar packages that must be installed before anything else zaqar_requires_pip_packages: - virtualenv - python-keystoneclient # Keystoneclient needed to OSA keystone lib

Pypi url changed from [1] to [2]

[1] https://pypi.python.org/pypi/<package>
[2] https://pypi.org/project/<package>

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2018-07-12 13:00:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn/commit/fcc913fef55a85aaac941fcdcd082076ffef9347', 'message': 'Add Heat support for Port Associations

Co-Author: Thomas Morin <thomas.morin@orange.com>

commit_message:
heat plugin: resources depend on the API extension being enabled

The Heat resource definition need to state that the resources
exist only if the 'bgpvpn' API extension is enabled in neutron.

Change-Id: I324e9c88564d000d654f694effa57c671165939d

commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

Change-Id: Ia6c57495b8d6090a0b98f17554288a310388c3e2

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-07 16:45:27.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/python-karborclient/commit/7aca76b32b6f89774ab1659a90bcba08b62a1700', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I8b2f1a62f8c9ca04d6c63f4a4ad22ec445bad88b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I8b2f1a62f8c9ca04d6c63f4a4ad22ec445bad88b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-karborclient refs/changes/38/573338/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3basepython = python3

commit_message:
Remove EXPERIMENTAL warning for manila docker deployments

These warnings should be present through stable/pike
but not thereafter since starting in stable/queens
containerized deployment of manila is supported.

Change-Id: Ib54cba0d336bde11af2adc3968e8ce8a6663aeff

commit_message:
Cleanup unittest file loading

Followup patch to update how test files are loaded accross all project:
- don't specify 'r' when opening a file as it is default mode
- use json.load(file) instead of json.loads(string)
- in some cases use file path inline instead of defining new var
- use loops to load several related files to avoid repetitive code

Change-Id: Ib4a66a4d97e7025849e3f84fc489fa1fa98af327

commit_message:
Execute service setup against a delegated host using Ansible built-in modules

In order to reduce the packages required to pip install on to the hosts,
we allow the service setup to be delegated to a specific host, defaulting
to the deploy host. We also switch as many tasks as possible to using the
built-in Ansible modules which make use of the shade library.

The 'virtualenv' package is now installed appropriately by the openstack_hosts
role, so there's no need to install it any more. The 'httplib2' package is a
legacy Ansible requirement for the get_url/get_uri module which is no longer
needed. The keystone client library is not required any more now that we're
using the upstream modules. As there are no required packages left, the task
to install them is also removed.

Change-Id: I81bb3f872dc93e54861cb720e3b37ab7660a074a

commit_message:
Incorrect error when using incorrect data in type of composite rule

aodh alarm create --type event --name mack --type composite
--composite-rule '{"or": [{"type": "ahhdhfjffkk"}]}' --alarm-action
https://requestb.in/1ivrvri1

Threshold rules should be combined with "and" or "or" (HTTP 400)
Error seems not relevant for the incorrect data.

Change-Id: I386e298c9cea25464c00ada37ddd18d24d1fd6ca
Closes-Bug: #1757973

commit_message:
WA for udevadm settle loops

There is an issue with 'udevadm settle' command described at [1]. It
turns out that inconsistent task IDs stored in queue.bin and
uevent_seqnum could cause udevadm settle to loop trying to find
the task that doesn't exist. Kernel developers are skeptical about
this issue and not willing to fix it, but even if they will, we
still will take it to MOS.

By default, it uses a timeout of 180 seconds that is inconsistent
with a set of existing nailgun-agent's timeouts. We can change this
timeout and I think that 15 sec will be a reasonable value

[1] https://lists.gt.net/linux/kernel/1524376

Change-Id: I0e71786c3516463496a313ea17438582a45ad2aa
Closes-bug: #1665584

commit_message:
DeployIdentifier should be provided for any parameter actions

DeployIdentifier is update during the deployment workflow in the
tripleo_common, but all the parameter update and get workflows,
before the depoloyment will fail since the parameter is not provided
for the heat stack validation. Adding a dummy entry for the DeployIdentifier
in the tripleoclient which will be replaced to a timestamp in the
deploy workflow.

Closes-Bug: #1759326
Change-Id: I26cc11895a376788d8aad41727676bec73a15d69
(cherry picked from commit 4cb7a225297e804fb00c037904142dea9262475b)

added_lines: # *Identifier will be update to timestamp value during the deploy # workflow, but till then for all heat stack validations, we need # and entry for starting the deploy action. parameters['DeployIdentifier'] = ''

subject: mysql/undercloud: add condition for upgrade
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-07-16 12:29:13.000000000', 'files': ['docker/services/database/mysql.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/cc05e522335bc9f1f66478a744d74b8c565e7845', 'message': 'mysql/undercloud: add condition for upgrade

The MySQL commands that we run during the upgrade of MySQL are useful
when upgrading a non-containerized undercloud (from instack-undercloud)
to a containerized undercloud, because we need to rename the Neutron
database to match with the defaults in THT.
So these 2 steps are only useful when MariaDB was actually running on
the host and not in a container.
Adding a conditional that checks if MariaDB is running and then we can
run these MySQL commands will ensure we can run the undercloud upgrade
in Rocky and beyond.

Change-Id: I34f3d5bae4838793fcbbc8832f288b11e6cd81f0
'}]
commit_message:
mysql/undercloud: add condition for upgrade

The MySQL commands that we run during the upgrade of MySQL are useful
when upgrading a non-containerized undercloud (from instack-undercloud)
to a containerized undercloud, because we need to rename the Neutron
database to match with the defaults in THT.
So these 2 steps are only useful when MariaDB was actually running on
the host and not in a container.
Adding a conditional that checks if MariaDB is running and then we can
run these MySQL commands will ensure we can run the undercloud upgrade
in Rocky and beyond.

Change-Id: I34f3d5bae4838793fcbbc8832f288b11e6cd81f0

commit_message:
V3 jsonschema validation: Volumes

This patch adds jsonschema validation for below Volumes API's
* POST /v3/{project_id}/volumes
* PUT  /v3/{project_id}/volumes/{volume_id}

Adding new Microversion 3.53, this will have impact on  both Create
and Update Volume API

* Create volume API will not accept additional properties like
  (user_id, project_id, status and attach_status).
* Update volume API will require minimum one parameter in request
  body otherwise it will raise 400 error.

APIImpact :
Before 3.53 version, create volume allows additional properties,
but now it will raise 400 error.
Also before 3.53 version, update volume allows empty body {},
but now it will raise 400 error.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1774155
Partial-Implements: bp json-schema-validation

Change-Id: I1829b6796cd6d3fa1040dd0fb9280bec5bdbc92e

commit_message:
Support alias for execution creation

This commit to support alias for execution creation, to create execution
only use function_alias pramater, and get function_id and function_version
from function_alias. Also add function tests for execution creation.

Change-Id: Iea6d3b3ac3d58d539fae88ffe455013ad08d2c43
Story: #2002143
Task: #19986

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I634e5ed6236ff0253b713b411ab203072485af2c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/70/573870/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-docs refs/changes/47/555347/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: set to an actual UUID later when `Configuring networks`_. Similarly, there are ``IronicProvisioningNetwork`` and ``IronicRescuingNetwork``. See `Configuring networks`_ for details. Configuring networksIronic has to be configured to use three networks for its internal purposes: * *Cleaning* network is used during cleaning and is mandatory to configure. This network can be configured to a name or UUID during deployment via the ``IronicCleaningNetwork`` parameter. Starting with the Queens release it can be also provided explicitly per node as described below. * *Provisioning* network is used during deployment if the *network interface* is set to ``neutron`` (either explicitly or via setting ``IronicDefaultNetworkInterface`` during installation). This network is supported by TripleO starting with the Pike release and can be configured to a name or UUID during deployment via the ``IronicProvisioningNetwork`` parameter. Starting with the Queens release it can be also provided explicitly per node as described below. * *Rescuing* network is used when starting the *rescue* process - repairing broken instances through a special ramdisk. This network is supported by TripleO starting with the Rocky release and can be configured to a name or UUID during deployment via the ``IronicRescuingNetwork`` parameter. Starting with the Queens release it can be also provided explicitly per node as described below. ``provisioning`` for all three networks by default. However, network names are not unique. A user creating another network with the same name will break bare metal provisioning. Thus, it's highly recommended to update the deployment,#. To update the whole deployment update the environment file you've created, setting ``IronicCleaningNetwork`` to the this UUID, for example:: .. admonition:: Newton :class: newton In the Newton release this parameter was not available, use ``cleaning_network_uuid`` hieradata value instead, for example:: parameter_defaults: ControllerExtraConfig: ironic::conductor::cleaning_network_uuid: c71f4bfe-409b-4292-818f-21cdf910ee06 This variable does not support node names and does not have a default value in this release. In the Pike release or newer, also set the provisioning network. You can use the same network or create a new one:: parameter_defaults: IronicCleaningNetwork: c71f4bfe-409b-4292-818f-21cdf910ee06 IronicProvisioningNetwork: c71f4bfe-409b-4292-818f-21cdf910ee06 In the Rocky release or newer, also set the rescuing network. You can use the same network or create a new one:: parameter_defaults: IronicCleaningNetwork: c71f4bfe-409b-4292-818f-21cdf910ee06 IronicProvisioningNetwork: c71f4bfe-409b-4292-818f-21cdf910ee06 IronicRescuingNetwork: c71f4bfe-409b-4292-818f-21cdf910ee06 Finally, run the deploy command with exactly the same arguments as before (don't forget to include the environment file if it was not included previously). #. Alternatively, you can set the networks per node starting with the Queens release. When enrolling nodes, add ``cleaning_network``, ``provisioning_network`` and/or ``rescuing_network`` to the ``driver_info`` dictionary when `Preparing inventory`_. After enrolling nodes, you can update each of them with the following command (adjusting it for your release):: openstack baremetal node set <node> \ --driver-info cleaning_network=<network uuid> \ --driver-info provisioning_network=<network uuid> \ --driver-info rescuing_network=<network uuid>
deleted_lines: set to an actual UUID later when `Configuring cleaning`_.Configuring cleaning``provisioning`` for node cleaning. However, network names are not unique. A user creating another network with the same name will break bare metal provisioning. Thus, it's highly recommended to update the deployment,Update the environment file you've created, setting ``IronicCleaningNetwork`` to the this UUID, for example::.. admonition:: Newton :class: newton In the Newton release this parameter was not available, use ``cleaning_network_uuid`` hieradata value instead, for example:: parameter_defaults: ControllerExtraConfig: ironic::conductor::cleaning_network_uuid: c71f4bfe-409b-4292-818f-21cdf910ee06 This variable does not support node names and does not have a default value in this release. Finally, run the deploy command with exactly the same arguments as before (don't forget to include the environment file if it was not included previously).

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I9a52c912ef5ad19fe24e9294f573a2770436d5e3

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7390869151d7bf6390b513ea078d4909d7d73055

commit_message:
Send update instead of remove for DVR reschedule

The current "agent remove-add" method to reschedule a router is not
friendly for DVR. In DVR cases, the old agent may still need to keep the
router in a non-master role to service any VM ports that exit on that
host while the new agent handles the master role of the router.

This patch proposes to send "update" instead of "remove" notification
for DVR rescheduling, which aligns with the retain_router check in
remove_router_from_l3_agent as well.

Closes-Bug: #1781179
Change-Id: I23431f9f46f72e6bce91f3d1fb0ed328d55930fb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/58/581658/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _check_router_retain_needed(self, context, router_id, host): """Check whether a router needs to be retained on a host. Check whether there are DVR serviceable ports owned by the host of a l3 agent. If so, then the routers should be retained. """ retain_router = False plugin = directory.get_plugin(plugin_constants.L3) router = self.get_router(context, router_id) if router.get('distributed'): subnet_ids = plugin.get_subnet_ids_on_router(context, router_id) if subnet_ids and host: retain_router = plugin._check_dvr_serviceable_ports_on_host( context, host, subnet_ids) return retain_router retain_router = self._check_router_retain_needed(context, router_id, agent.host) retain_router = self._check_router_retain_needed(context, router_id, host) if retain_router: l3_notifier.routers_updated_on_host( context, [router_id], host) else: l3_notifier.router_removed_from_agent( context, router_id, host)
deleted_lines: retain_router = False if router.get('distributed'): subnet_ids = plugin.get_subnet_ids_on_router(context, router_id) if subnet_ids and agent.host: retain_router = plugin._check_dvr_serviceable_ports_on_host( context, agent.host, subnet_ids) l3_notifier.router_removed_from_agent( context, router_id, host)

commit_message:
Update requirements handling

Do not use -U for requirements, it will update requirements which can
lead to installation of unwanted versions.

Give test-requirements the usual name so that our jobs handle it
properly.

Add neutron to test-requirements so that Depends-On works. OpenStack CI
will install from git.

Update requirements to current version so that requirements check
passes. Remove unused markupsafe requirement.

Change-Id: I8ed063d024055077aef75cda2acc13af0d90c2bd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-calico refs/changes/25/553425/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
vars: SUSE: Drop python-pycrypto from SUSE packages

Commit c41b80cee994 ("Remove python-crypto and use in-repo GPG keys")
removed the ancient python-crypto package from CentOS but it didn't do
it for SUSE. Similar to CentOS, we don't need python-crypto anymore for
Galera so we can simply drop it.

Fixes: c41b80cee994 ("Remove python-crypto and use in-repo GPG keys")
Change-Id: If8fc1641cc26e98e2851ccae95827fcfc4794282

commit_message:
Update glance documentation for trait support

Required traits on the image allow specifying a server to be
built only on compute nodes which express those traits. The
Nova Scheduler has been updated to look at the image trait
properties when selecting compute nodes.

Updating the documentation for glance to explain the same.

Documentation is similar to flavor required traits documentation available
here: https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/user/flavors.html#extra-specs

Change-Id: I716821abf44238eecc9c4a1d198d8a31b87dedce
Implements: blueprint glance-image-traits
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/20/581920/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - ``trait:<trait_name>`` - Added in the Rocky release. traits allow specifying a server to build on a compute node with the set of traits specified in the image. The traits are associated with the resource provider that represents the compute node in the Placement API. The syntax of specifying traits is trait:<trait_name>=value For example: trait:HW_CPU_X86_AVX2=required trait:STORAGE_DISK_SSD=required The scheduler will pass required traits to the Placement API to include only resource providers that can satisfy the required traits. Image traits are used by the scheduler even in cases of volume backed instances, if the volume source is an image with traits. The FilterScheduler is currently the only scheduler driver that supports this feature. - Only valid value is required, any other value is invalid. * ``required`` - <trait_name> is required on the resource provider that represents the compute node on which the image is launched. * - All

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Ieca57f7c2e6b2ff5c95f8643985ad760c71e0fc3

commit_message:
Add QOS Driver for Hyper-V Network Virtualization (SDN 2.0)

Depends-On: I3c7e9aaa2ad98c98423c50b17991115835fa77f4

Co-Authored-By: Alexandru Coman <acoman@cloudbasesolutions.com>
Co-Authored-By: Claudiu Belu <cbelu@cloudbasesolutions.com>
Partially implements: blueprint hyperv-network-virtualization-support

Change-Id: I95b934ee53886c7d54d19ac5584fdaef27fc35f6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-hyperv refs/changes/41/436041/30 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2017 Cloudbase Solutions Srl # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log as logging from hnv import client as hnv_client from neutron import context as n_context from neutron.objects.qos import policy as qos_policy from neutron.objects.qos import rule as qos_rule from neutron.plugins.ml2 import plugin as ml2_plugin from neutron.services.qos.notification_drivers import qos_base from neutron_lib import constants from neutron_lib.plugins import directory from hyperv.common.i18n import _LI CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.import_group('HNV', 'hnv.config') LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class HNVQosNotificationDriver(qos_base.QosServiceNotificationDriverBase): """OVN notification driver for QoS.""" def __init__(self): self._driver_property = None def get_description(self): """Get the notification driver description.""" return "HNV notification driver" @property def _driver(self): if self._driver_property is None: plugin = directory.get_plugin() if isinstance(plugin, ml2_plugin.Ml2Plugin): self._driver_property = \ plugin.mechanism_manager.mech_drivers['hnv'].obj return self._driver_property def create_policy(self, context, policy): """Create the QoS policy.""" pass # No need to update HNV on create def update_policy(self, context, policy): """Update the QoS policy. Apply changes to the QoS policy. """ # Call into qos_driver to update the policy self._driver.qos.update_policy(context, policy) def delete_policy(self, context, policy): """Delete the QoS policy. Remove all rules for this policy and free up all the resources. """ pass # No need to update HNV on delete class HNVQosDriver(object): """Qos driver for HNV""" def __init__(self, driver): LOG.info(_LI("Starting HNVQosDriver")) super(HNVQosDriver, self).__init__() self._driver = driver self._plugin_property = None @property def _plugin(self): if self._plugin_property is None: self._plugin_property = directory.get_plugin() return self._plugin_property def _is_network_device_port(self, port): device_owner = port.get('device_owner') if (device_owner and device_owner.startswith(constants.DEVICE_OWNER_PREFIXES)): return True return False def _generate_port_options(self, context, policy_id): if policy_id is None: return None # The policy might not have any rules all_rules = qos_rule.get_rules(context, policy_id) for rule in all_rules: if isinstance(rule, qos_rule.QosBandwidthLimitRule): if rule.max_kbps: qos_settings = hnv_client.QosSettings( outbound_maximum_mbps=str(rule.max_kbps / 1024), inbound_maximum_mbps=str(rule.max_kbps / 1024) ) return qos_settings def get_qos_options(self, port): # Is qos service enabled if 'qos_policy_id' not in port: return None # Don't apply qos rules to network devices if self._is_network_device_port(port): return None # Determine if port or network policy should be used context = n_context.get_admin_context() port_policy_id = port.get('qos_policy_id') network_policy_id = None if not port_policy_id: network_policy = qos_policy.QosPolicy.get_network_policy( context, port['network_id']) network_policy_id = network_policy.id if network_policy else None # Generate qos options for the selected policy policy_id = port_policy_id or network_policy_id return self._generate_port_options(context, policy_id) def _update_network_ports(self, context, network_id): # Retrieve all ports for this network ports = self._plugin.get_ports(context, filters={'network_id': [network_id]}) for port in ports: # Don't apply qos rules if port has a policy port_policy_id = port.get('qos_policy_id') if port_policy_id: continue # Don't apply qos rules to network devices if self._is_network_device_port(port): continue # Call into mech driver to update port self._driver.update_port(port, network_id) def update_network(self, network, old_network): policy_id = network.get("qos_policy_id") old_policy_id = old_network.get("qos_policy_id") # TODO(gsamfira): When removing a policy, both current and # original networks hold the same value. LOG.debug("Changing policies from %(old_policy_id)s " "to %(policy_id)s", {'old_policy_id': old_policy_id, 'policy_id': policy_id}) # Update the qos options on each network port context = n_context.get_admin_context() self._update_network_ports(context, network.get('id')) def update_policy(self, context, policy): self._generate_port_options(context, policy.id) # Update each network bound to this policy network_bindings = policy.get_bound_networks() for network_id in network_bindings: self._update_network_ports(context, network_id) # Update each port bound to this policy port_bindings = policy.get_bound_ports() for port_id in port_bindings: port = self._plugin.get_port(context, port_id) self._driver.update_port(port, port["network_id"])

commit_message:
Add ACLs Driver for Hyper-V Network Virtualization (SDN 2.0)

Co-Authored-By: Alexandru Coman <acoman@cloudbasesolutions.com>
Co-Authored-By: Claudiu Belu <cbelu@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Partially implements: blueprint hyperv-network-virtualization-support

Change-Id: Ia207878dcfb70b929583ca2df0a9a2ce4ed2d5c4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-hyperv refs/changes/42/436042/42 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: AGENT_TYPE_HNV = "HNV agent" HNV_DEFAULT_NETWORK = "Neutron_Default" HNV_METHOD_STATIC = "Static" HNV_METHOD_DYNAMIC = "Dynamic" HNV_PORT_PROFILE_ID = "port_profile_id" HNV_PROVIDER_NAME = "openstack" HNV_MIN_ACLS = 3

subject: Add PublicIPAddress manager for Hyper-V Network Virtualization (SDN 2.0)

commit_message:
Add PublicIPAddress manager for Hyper-V Network Virtualization (SDN 2.0)

The PublicIPAddressManager will be used by the HNVMechanismDriver.

Co-Authored-By: Alexandru Coman <acoman@cloudbasesolutions.com>
Co-Authored-By: Claudiu Belu <cbelu@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Partially implements: blueprint hyperv-network-virtualization-support

Change-Id: Ia715872447ade75ef59d2182907123df19bacef9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-hyperv refs/changes/44/436044/50 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class PublicIPAddressManager(HNVMixin): def _get_vip_id(self, port): owner = port.get("device_owner") if owner != const.DEVICE_OWNER_FLOATINGIP: raise ValueError("Invalid port owner for floating IP: %r" % owner) vip_id = port.get("device_id") if not vip_id: raise ValueError("Port does not have device ID assigned") return vip_id def _create(self, port): vip_id = self._get_vip_id(port) ips = port.get("fixed_ips") if len(ips) == 0: LOG.debug("No fixed_ips to work with") return try: return hnv_client.PublicIPAddresses.get(resource_id=vip_id) except hnv_exception.NotFound: LOG.debug("Creating public IP address %(public_ip)s", {'public_ip': ips[0]["ip_address"]}) subnet = self._get_lnsubnet_for_ip(ips[0]) if not subnet: raise Exception("Failed to find subnet for ip %(ip)s in " "network controller" % {"ip": ips["ip_address"]}) public_ip = hnv_client.PublicIPAddresses( tags={"provider": constants.HNV_PROVIDER_NAME}, resource_id=vip_id, ip_address=ips[0]["ip_address"], allocation_method="Static", idle_timeout=4).commit(wait=True) return public_ip def _delete_by_id(self, vip_id, fixed_ips=None): ips = fixed_ips try: vip = hnv_client.PublicIPAddresses.get(resource_id=vip_id) except hnv_exception.NotFound: return if vip.ip_configuration: # if we get here, it means that neutron has already # dissassociated this IP address from its ports and # has issued a delete. We may be out of sync. Disassociate # IP and delete args = {'floating_ip_id': vip_id} if ips: args["floating_ip_address"] = ips[0]["ip_address"] self._disassociate_public_ip(args) vip.remove(resource_id=vip.resource_id) def _delete(self, port): vip_id = self._get_vip_id(port) self._delete_by_id(vip_id) def _get_vip(self, vip_id, vip=None): public_ip = hnv_client.PublicIPAddresses.get(resource_id=vip_id) if vip and public_ip.ip_address != vip: raise ValueError( "floating_ip_address %(neutron_address)s has " "a different value from the IP associated with " "floating_ip_id in the network controller %(nc_address)s" % {'neutron_address': vip, 'nc_address': public_ip.ip_address}) return public_ip def _associate_public_ip(self, assoc_data): dip = assoc_data["fixed_ip_address"] net_adapter_id = assoc_data["fixed_port_id"] vip_address = assoc_data["floating_ip_address"] vip_id = assoc_data["floating_ip_id"] vip_obj = self._get_vip(vip_id, vip_address) net_adapter = hnv_client.NetworkInterfaces.get( resource_id=net_adapter_id) found = False for idx, _ in enumerate(net_adapter.ip_configurations): if net_adapter.ip_configurations[idx].private_ip_address == dip: net_adapter.ip_configurations[idx].public_ip_address = vip_obj found = True break if not found: raise Exception("Failed to find DIP %(dip)s on network interface " "%(network_interface)s" % {'dip': dip, 'network_interface': net_adapter_id}) return net_adapter.commit(wait=True) def _disassociate_public_ip(self, assoc_data): vip_address = assoc_data.get("floating_ip_address") vip_id = assoc_data["floating_ip_id"] vip_obj = self._get_vip(vip_id, vip_address) if not vip_obj.ip_configuration: return ip = vip_obj.ip_configuration.get_resource() net_iface = hnv_client.NetworkInterfaces.get(resource_id=ip.parent_id) for idx, vip in enumerate(net_iface.ip_configurations): if net_iface.ip_configurations[idx].resource_id == ip.resource_id: pub_ip = net_iface.ip_configurations[idx].public_ip_address if pub_ip: net_iface.ip_configurations[idx].public_ip_address = None break net_iface.commit(wait=True) def get_vip_for_internal_port(self, port, ip): port_id = port["id"] filters = { 'fixed_port_id': [port_id], 'fixed_ip_address': [ip] } floating_ip = self.get_floatingips(self._admin_context, filters=filters) if not floating_ip: return None vip = hnv_client.PublicIPAddresses.get( resource_id=floating_ip[0]["id"]) resource = hnv_client.Resource(resource_ref=vip.resource_ref) return resource @classmethod def get_all(self): vips = hnv_client.PublicIPAddresses.get() ret = {} for vip in vips: provider = (vip.tags or {}).get("provider") if provider != constants.HNV_PROVIDER_NAME: continue ret[vip.resource_id] = vip return ret @classmethod def update_vip_association(cls, assoc_data): manager = cls() dip = assoc_data["fixed_ip_address"] net_adapter_id = assoc_data["fixed_port_id"] if dip and net_adapter_id: return manager._associate_public_ip(assoc_data) return manager._disassociate_public_ip(assoc_data) @classmethod def bulk_create(cls, ports): manager = cls() for port in ports: manager._create(port) @classmethod def create(cls, port): manager = cls() return manager._create(port) @classmethod def remove(cls, port): manger = cls() return manger._delete(port) @classmethod def bulk_remove_by_id(cls, ports): manager = cls() for port in ports: manager._delete_by_id(port) elif owner == const.DEVICE_OWNER_FLOATINGIP: return PublicIPAddressManager()

commit_message:
Add LoadBalancer manager for Hyper-V Network Virtualization (SDN 2.0)

The LoadBalancerManager will be used by the HNVMechanismDriver.

Co-Authored-By: Alexandru Coman <acoman@cloudbasesolutions.com>
Co-Authored-By: Claudiu Belu <cbelu@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Partially implements: blueprint hyperv-network-virtualization-support

Change-Id: I31ca6832d053ad675e36f5192b29d2b9fef39a29
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-hyperv refs/changes/43/436043/37 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2017 Cloudbase Solutions Srl # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import netaddr from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log from neutron_lib import constants as const from hnv import client as hnv_client from hnv.common import exception as hnv_exception from neutron import context as n_context from neutron.db import common_db_mixin from neutron.db import extraroute_db from neutron_lib.plugins import directory from hyperv.neutron import constants CONF = cfg.CONF CONF.import_group('HNV', 'hnv.config') LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) class HNVMixin(common_db_mixin.CommonDbMixin, extraroute_db.ExtraRoute_dbonly_mixin): @property def _admin_context(self): if not self._admin_context_property: self._admin_context_property = n_context.get_admin_context() return self._admin_context_property @property def _plugin(self): if not self._plugin_property: self._plugin_property = directory.get_plugin() return self._plugin_property @staticmethod def _get_virtual_networks(ids): virtual_networks = hnv_client.VirtualNetworks.get() return [virtual_network for virtual_network in virtual_networks if virtual_network.resource_id in ids] def _get_lnsubnet_for_ip(self, ip_address): subnet_id = ip_address["subnet_id"] subnet = self._plugin.get_subnet(self._admin_context, subnet_id) subnet = hnv_client.LogicalSubnetworks.get( parent_id=subnet["network_id"], resource_id=subnet_id) network = netaddr.IPNetwork(subnet.address_prefix) if ip_address["ip_address"] in network: return subnet return None def _get_lb_for_router(self, router): ext_port_id = router.get("gw_port_id") if not ext_port_id: LOG.debug("Router %s has no external network set. " "Nothing to do here", router["id"]) return ext_port = self._plugin.get_port(self._admin_context, ext_port_id) loadbalancer = LoadBalancerManager.get(ext_port) if not loadbalancer.backend_address_pools: LOG.debug("There are no backend address pools defined on %s", loadbalancer.resource_id) return return loadbalancer def _get_lb_for_router_by_id(self, router_id): router = self.get_router(self._admin_context, router_id) return self._get_lb_for_router(router) def _get_attached_router_interfaces(self, context, router_id): filters = { "device_id": [router_id], "device_owner": [const.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_INTF] } ports = self._plugin.get_ports(context, filters=filters) return ports def _get_network_interfaces(self, ids): networks = hnv_client.NetworkInterfaces.get() return {network.resource_id: network for network in networks if network.resource_id in ids} def _get_subnet_info_from_interface(self, interface): net_id = interface["network_id"] subnet_info_from_interface = [] fixed_ips = interface.get("fixed_ips", []) for ip_address in fixed_ips: subnet_info = {'network_id': net_id, 'subnet_id': ip_address["subnet_id"]} if subnet_info not in subnet_info_from_interface: subnet_info_from_interface.append(subnet_info) return subnet_info_from_interface class LoadBalancerManager(HNVMixin): def __init__(self): self._ln_cache = {} self._subnet_lb_cache = {} @staticmethod def _get_resource_ids(port): return { "lb-id": "lb-%s" % port["id"], "fe-id": "fe-%s" % port["id"], "be-id": "fe-%s" % port["id"], "onat-id": "onat-%s" % port["id"], } @classmethod def _get_load_balancer(cls, port): resource_ids = cls._get_resource_ids(port) return hnv_client.LoadBalancers.get(resource_id=resource_ids["lb-id"]) @staticmethod def _remove_load_balancer_by_id(lb_id): hnv_client.LoadBalancers.remove(resource_id=lb_id) @classmethod def _remove_load_balancer(cls, port): resource_ids = cls._get_resource_ids(port) cls._remove_load_balancer_by_id(resource_ids["lb-id"]) def _get_logical_network(self, network_id): if self._ln_cache.get(network_id): return self._ln_cache[network_id] logical_network = hnv_client.LogicalNetworks.get( resource_id=network_id) self._ln_cache[network_id] = logical_network return self._ln_cache[network_id] def _get_frontend_ip_configurations(self, ips, resource_ids): frontend_ip_configurations = [] for ip_address in ips: frontend_id = "%s-%s" % (resource_ids["fe-id"], ip_address["ip_address"]) ip_subnet = self._get_lnsubnet_for_ip(ip_address) if not ip_subnet: raise Exception("Failed to find subnet for ip %(ip)s in " "network controller" % {"ip": ip_address["ip_address"]}) # TODO(gsamfira): Consider using wait=False wherever possible. ip_configuration = hnv_client.FrontendIPConfigurations( tags={"provider": constants.HNV_PROVIDER_NAME}, parent_id=resource_ids["lb-id"], resource_id=frontend_id, subnet=ip_subnet, private_ip_address=ip_address["ip_address"], private_ip_allocation_method="Static") frontend_ip_configurations.append(ip_configuration) return frontend_ip_configurations def _create_load_balancer(self, port): resource_ids = self._get_resource_ids(port) try: return hnv_client.LoadBalancers.get(resource_ids["lb-id"]) except hnv_exception.NotFound: LOG.debug("Creating new load balancer %s" % resource_ids["lb-id"]) fixed_ips = port.get("fixed_ips") if not fixed_ips: LOG.debug("No fixed ips set on this port. Nothing to do") return frontend_ip_configurations = self._get_frontend_ip_configurations( fixed_ips, resource_ids) if not frontend_ip_configurations: raise Exception("Failed to get frontend IP configurations") backend_address_pool = hnv_client.BackendAddressPools( tags={"provider": constants.HNV_PROVIDER_NAME}, parent_id=resource_ids["lb-id"], resource_id=resource_ids["be-id"]) outbound_nat_rules = hnv_client.OutboundNATRules( tags={"provider": constants.HNV_PROVIDER_NAME}, resource_id=resource_ids["onat-id"], parent_id=resource_ids["lb-id"], frontend_ip_configurations=frontend_ip_configurations, backend_address_pool=backend_address_pool, protocol="All") loadbalancer = hnv_client.LoadBalancers( tags={"provider": constants.HNV_PROVIDER_NAME}, resource_id=resource_ids["lb-id"], outbound_nat_rules=[outbound_nat_rules], backend_address_pools=[backend_address_pool], frontend_ip_configurations=frontend_ip_configurations) loadbalancer.commit(wait=True) return loadbalancer def _get_router_interfaces_for_subnet(self, subnet): filters = { 'network_id': [subnet["network_id"]], 'device_owner': [const.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_INTF], 'fixed_ips': {'subnet_id': [subnet["subnet_id"]]} } ports = self._plugin.get_ports(self._admin_context, filters=filters) return ports def _subnet_cache_key(self, subnet): return "%s-%s" % (subnet["subnet_id"], subnet["network_id"]) def _get_lb_for_port(self, port): # TODO(gsamfira): Check if there is an easier way to get the # gw_port_id starting from the port of a VM subnet_info = self._get_subnet_info_from_interface(port) lb_for_port = [] for subnet in subnet_info: cache_key = self._subnet_cache_key(subnet) if cache_key in self._subnet_lb_cache: lb_for_port.append(self._subnet_lb_cache[cache_key]) continue router_int = self._get_router_interfaces_for_subnet(subnet) for r_int in router_int: router_id = r_int["device_id"] loadbalancer = self._get_lb_for_router_by_id(router_id) if not loadbalancer: continue self._subnet_lb_cache[cache_key] = loadbalancer lb_for_port.append(loadbalancer) return lb_for_port @classmethod def get_all(cls): vips = hnv_client.LoadBalancers.get() ret = {} for virtual_ip in vips: provider = (virtual_ip.tags or {}).get("provider") if not provider != constants.HNV_PROVIDER_NAME: continue ret[virtual_ip.resource_id[3:]] = virtual_ip return ret def get_port_backend_pool(self, port): lbs = self._get_lb_for_port(port) port_backend_poo = [] for loadbalancer in lbs: address_pool = loadbalancer.backend_address_pools[0] resource = hnv_client.Resource( resource_ref=address_pool.resource_ref) port_backend_poo.append(resource) return port_backend_poo @classmethod def bulk_create(cls, ports): manager = cls() for port in ports: manager._create_load_balancer(port) @classmethod def create(cls, port): return cls()._create_load_balancer(port) @classmethod def remove(cls, port): return cls._remove_load_balancer(port) @classmethod def bulk_remove_by_id(cls, ports): for port in ports: cls._remove_load_balancer_by_id(port) @classmethod def get(cls, port): return cls._get_load_balancer(port) def get_manager(port): """Get the required manager for the received port.""" owner = port.get("device_owner") if owner == const.DEVICE_OWNER_ROUTER_GW: return LoadBalancerManager()

commit_message:
Add HNV layer 3 router plugin

Co-Authored-By: Alexandru Coman <acoman@cloudbasesolutions.com>
Co-Authored-By: Claudiu Belu <cbelu@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Partially implements: blueprint hyperv-network-virtualization-support
Change-Id: I30b1d91da410d1f7ce34508fd5f31da075d6b2b3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-hyperv refs/changes/83/436483/39 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.callbacks import registry from neutron.callbacks import resources from neutron.callbacks import eventsfrom neutron.services import service_base from neutron.plugins.common import constants as n_constantfrom hyperv.common import i18nclass HNVL3RouterPlugin(service_base.ServicePluginBase, HNVMixin): supported_extension_aliases = ['router', 'extraroute'] def __init__(self): super(HNVL3RouterPlugin, self).__init__() LOG.info(i18n._LI("Starting HNVL3RouterPlugin")) self._public_ip = PublicIPAddressManager() self._lb = LoadBalancerManager() self.subscribe() def subscribe(self): # Removing a router gateway will delete the coresponding load balancer # which in turn will cascade and remove the load balancer from all # interfaces that had it configured registry.subscribe(self.process_floating_ip_update, resources.FLOATING_IP, events.AFTER_UPDATE) def process_floating_ip_update(self, resource, event, trigger, **kwargs): self._public_ip.update_vip_association(kwargs) def get_plugin_type(self): return n_constant.L3_ROUTER_NAT def get_plugin_description(self): """returns string description of the plugin.""" return ("L3 Router Service Plugin for basic L3 forwarding" " using HNV") def _get_ip_configurations_for_subnet(self, interface_info): ip_configurations_for_subnet = [] net_id = interface_info["network_id"] subnet_ids = interface_info.get("subnet_ids", []) for subnet_id in subnet_ids: nc_subnet = hnv_client.SubNetworks.get( parent_id=net_id, resource_id=subnet_id) if nc_subnet.ip_configuration: for ip_conf in nc_subnet.ip_configuration: ip_configurations_for_subnet.append(ip_conf) return ip_configurations_for_subnet def _get_ip_configs_from_subnets(self, subnets): ip_configurations = [] net_ids = [subnet["network_id"] for subnet in subnets] virt_nets = self._get_virtual_networks(net_ids) for net in virt_nets: for sub in net.subnetworks: details = { "network_id": sub.parent_id, "subnet_id": sub.resource_id } if details in subnets: for ip_address in sub.ip_configuration: ip_configurations.append(ip_address) return ip_configurations def _apply_lb_on_ip_configs(self, ip_configs, loadbalancer): for ip_config in ip_configs: ip_configuration = ip_config.get_resource() network_interface = hnv_client.NetworkInterfaces.get( resource_id=ip_configuration.parent_id) for configuration in network_interface.ip_configurations: if configuration.resource_id == ip_configuration.resource_id: address_pool = loadbalancer.backend_address_pools[0] resource = hnv_client.Resource( resource_ref=address_pool.resource_ref) configuration.backend_address_pools.append(resource) break network_interface.commit(wait=True) def _apply_lb_on_connected_networks(self, router_interfaces, loadbalancer): subnets = [] for interface in router_interfaces: info = self._get_subnet_info_from_interface(interface) for subnet in info: if subnet in subnets: continue subnets.append(subnet) ip_configs = self._get_ip_configs_from_subnets(subnets) self._apply_lb_on_ip_configs(ip_configs, loadbalancer) def update_router(self, context, identifier, router): updated = super(HNVL3RouterPlugin, self).update_router( context, identifier, router) original_router = self.get_router(context, identifier) original_gw = original_router.get("gw_port_id") if original_gw: loadbalancer = self._get_lb_for_router(original_router) external_port = updated.get("gw_port_id") if external_port == original_gw: return updated router_id = updated["id"] if external_port: router_interfaces = self._get_attached_router_interfaces( context, router_id) loadbalancer = self._get_lb_for_router(updated) self._apply_lb_on_connected_networks(router_interfaces, loadbalancer) return updated def add_router_interface(self, context, router_id, interface_info): interfaces = self._get_attached_router_interfaces(context, router_id) subnet = self._plugin.get_subnet(self._admin_context, interface_info["subnet_id"]) for interface in interfaces: if subnet["network_id"] != interface["network_id"]: raise Exception( "HNV does not support setting a load balancer on subnets " "from different virtual networks. Please create a new " "router if you need to offer outbound NAT functionality " "to your VMs. Currently attached network: " "%(attached_net)s" % {"attached_net": interface["network_id"]}) router_info = super(HNVL3RouterPlugin, self).add_router_interface( context, router_id, interface_info) ip_configs = self._get_ip_configurations_for_subnet(router_info) if not ip_configs: LOG.debug("No IP configurations found for any of the subnets " "configured on %s" % router_info["network_id"]) loadbalancer = self._get_lb_for_router_by_id(router_id) if not loadbalancer: return self._apply_lb_on_ip_configs(ip_configs, loadbalancer) return router_info def remove_router_interface(self, context, router_id, interface_info): router_info = super(HNVL3RouterPlugin, self).remove_router_interface( context, router_id, interface_info) ip_configs = self._get_ip_configurations_for_subnet(router_info) if not ip_configs: LOG.debug("No IP configurations found for any of the subnets " "configured on %s" % router_info["network_id"]) loadbalancer = self._get_lb_for_router_by_id(router_id) if not loadbalancer: return for resource in ip_configs: # Note(gsamfira): For some reason, the IPConfiguration resource # does not allow PUT operations. # We have to get the NetworkInterface object and update that. ip_configuration = resource.get_resource() interface = hnv_client.NetworkInterfaces.get( resource_id=ip_configuration.parent_id) for configuration in interface.ip_configurations: if configuration.resource_id != ip_configuration.resource_id: continue lb_address_pools = loadbalancer.backend_address_pools[0] resource = hnv_client.Resource( resource_ref=lb_address_pools.resource_ref) backend_pools = configuration.backend_address_pools pools_ids = [pool.resource_ref for pool in backend_pools] new_backend_pools = [] for backend in backend_pools: if resource.resource_ref in pools_ids: continue new_backend_pools.append(backend) configuration.backend_address_pools = new_backend_pools break interface.commit(wait=False) return router_info

Add HNV mechanism driver

Co-Authored-By: Alexandru Coman <acoman@cloudbasesolutions.com>
Partially implements: blueprint hyperv-network-virtualization-support
